alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Steuben, southeastern Branch, southwestern Hillsdale and northwestern Williams Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fremont, or near Angola, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Angola around 650 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 345 and 357. Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 140 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. We received a report of a funnel cloud with this storm. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
